poem:
Title: The Sea-Scarred Geopolitics  

Under the veil of blue vastness,
Brimstone's iron rain fell.
War's fingertips trace the Red Sea,
Breathing threats in deep swells.

A volley of metal scorn, 
Britannia echoes Yank's dread.
The harbingers of storm,
Warning of blood yet to be shed.

In the glittering silence aftermath,
West's wrath is sown,
Insinuating steel paths, 
Across the Yemen's forlorn home.
